required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Phase Study to Assess Efficacy and Safety of AZD9567 Versus Prednisolone in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2a, Randomised, Double-blind, Parallel Study to Assess the Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of AZD9567 Compared to Prednisolone 20 mg in Patients With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 2a study to be run in 2-3 countries in European Union involving 5-6 sites. It will enroll approximately 80 patients to ensure 40 randomized with active rheumatoid arthritis. The treatment period is 2 weeks and total study duration per patient is approximately 1 month. The study drugs are AZD9567 40 mg (an oral SGRM) and the comparator is prednisolone 20mg. The primary endpoint is DAS28 including evaluation of 28 joints and C-reactive protein. Safety parameters will also be evaluated and a biomarker program is included for future research.

detailed_description.textblock:
This randomized double blind with double dummy technique phase 2a study will be run in 2-3 EU countries, most likely Sweden, Denmark and The Netherlands involving 5-6 sites. It is estimated that 80-100 patients have to be enrolled to ensure the randomization target of 40. The study population is patients with rheumatoid arthritis on stable treatment with conventional disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (DMARDs) with an active flare. It is a two-arm parallel study and the randomization ratio is 1:1 to the two weeks of once daily treatment of 40 mg of AZD9567 and 20 mg prednisolone.
The primary objective is to assess the efficacy of AZD9567 40 mg, compared to prednisolone 20 mg in patients with active rheumatoid arthritis in spite of stable treatment with conventional and/or s.c/i.v. biological DMARDs and the primary variable is change from baseline in 28 joint Disease Activity Score using CRP (DAS28 - CRP). As secondary variables swollen and tenderness of 66-68 joints and safety variables are also included. For exploratively purposes there is also a biomarker program, collecting blood samples for future research.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized, double blind, parallell arm study with two weeks treatment of AZD9567 or prednisolone

primary_outcome.measure: Least Square (LS) Mean Change From Baseline in 28 Joint Disease Activity Score Using C-Reactive Protein (DAS28-CRP) at Day 15
primary_outcome.description: The DAS28-CRP is a measure of disease activity in RA. The score includes the number of tender and swollen joints (out of 28), CRP level (a measure of inflammation in the blood), and the patient's global assessment (PGA) of health (ranging from very well to very poor). The DAS28-CRP was derived as follows: 0.56 x √[tender joint count 28 (TJC28)] + 0.28 x √[swollen joint count 28 (SJC28)] + 0.014 x global health (GH) + 0.36 x Ln(CRP+1) + 0.96 to produce the overall DAS28-CRP score on a scale ranged from 0-10 with higher score indicating worse RA symptoms. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20, ACR50 and ACR70 Responses
secondary_outcome.description: The ACR20, ACR50 or ACR70 was achieved if there was at least a 20%, 50% or 70% improvement from baseline in swollen joint count 66 (SJC66) and tender joint count 68 (TJC68) and 3 or more of the 5 following assessments: participant's assessment of pain, GH, physician's global assessment of disease activity, participant's assessment of physical function and CRP. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: LS Mean Change From Baseline in SJC66 Score at Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: A total of 66 joints (33 left, 33 right) were evaluated for swelling. The swollen joint count represents the number of joints in which there was synovial fluid and or soft tissue swelling, but not if bony overgrowth was found. A swollen joint was scored as 0 (absent) and 1 (present) for each joint. The SJC66 was calculated as sum of swollen joints with present status on electronic case report form (eCRF). The swollen joint count ranged from 0-66 with higher score indicating disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: LS Mean Change From Baseline in TJC68 Score at Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: A total of 68 joints (34 left, 34 right) were evaluated for tenderness. The tender joint count represents the number of joints in which pain was reported. A tender joint was scored as 0 (absent) and 1 (present) for each joint. The TJC68 was calculated as sum of tender joints with present status on eCRF. The tender joint count ranged from 0-68 with higher score indicating disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: LS Mean Change From Baseline in TJC28 Score at Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: TJC28 was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the DAS28-score. A total of 28 joints (14 left, 14 right) were evaluated for tenderness as obtained from the joint count right or left eCRF. The tender joint count represents the number of joints in which pain was reported. A tender joint was scored as 0 (absent) and 1 (present) for each joint. The TJC28 was calculated as sum of tender joints with present status on eCRF. The tender joint count ranged from 0-28 with higher score indicating disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: LS Mean Change From Baseline in SJC28 Score at Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: SJC28 was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the DAS28-score. A total of 28 joints (14 left, 14 right) were evaluated for swelling as obtained from the joint count right or left eCRF. The swollen joint count represents the number of joints in which there was synovial fluid and or soft tissue swelling, but not if bony overgrowth was found. A swollen joint was scored as 0 (absent) and 1 (present) for each joint. The SJC28 was calculated as sum of swollen joints with present status on eCRF. The swollen joint count ranged from 0-28 with higher score indicating disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: LS Mean Change From Baseline in GH Score at Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: GH was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the DAS28-score. Participant's GH was measured using PGA of disease activity by means of the visual analogue scale (VAS). The PGA VAS consists of a 100 millimeter (mm) long scale ranging from 0 (very well) to 100 (very poor). Higher score indicated greater disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: LS Mean Change From Baseline in CRP at Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: CRP was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the DAS28-score. The CRP was collected at the local laboratory during screening and central laboratory on Days 1, 8, 15 and 28. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: LS Mean Change From Baseline in Participant's Assessment of Pain Score at Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's assessment of pain score was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the ACR. Participant's assessment of pain score was assessed from the amount of pain due to RA on a VAS ranging from 0 (no pain) to 100 (extreme pain). Higher score indicated greater disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: LS Mean Change From Baseline in Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity Score at Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: Physician's global assessment of disease activity score was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the ACR. The physician's global assessment of disease activity was measured on a VAS ranging from 0 (very well) to 100 (very poor). Higher score indicated greater disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: LS Mean Change From Baseline in Participant's Assessment of Physical Function Score at Day 15
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's assessment of physical function score was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the ACR. The participant's assessment of physical function across 8 functional areas was measured by health assessment questionnaire. The total score ranging from 0 (no difficulty) to 24 (inability to perform tasks). Higher score indicated greater disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve Until the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of AZD9567
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4 and 6 hour postdose on Day 15.
secondary_outcome.description: The AUClast was determined using non-compartmental method and calculated using the linear trapezoidal rule when concentrations were increased and the logarithmic trapezoidal rule when concentrations were decreased.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to 6 Hours After Dose (AUC0-6) of AZD9567
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4 and 6 hour postdose on Day 15.
secondary_outcome.description: The AUC0-6 was determined using non-compartmental method and calculated using the linear trapezoidal rule when concentrations were increased and the logarithmic trapezoidal rule when concentrations were decreased.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of AZD9567
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4 and 6 hour postdose on Day 15.
secondary_outcome.description: The Cmax of AZD9567 was determined using non-compartmental method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of AZD9567
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4 and 6 hour postdose on Day 15.
secondary_outcome.description: The tmax of AZD9567 was determined using non-compartmental method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Last Plasma Concentration Measured Before the Last Dose (Ctrough) of AZD9567
secondary_outcome.description: The Ctrough of AZD9567 was determined using non-compartmental method before the last dose on Day 15.

arm_group.description: oral suspension of 40 mg AZD9567 once daily (OD) for two weeks
oral OD treatment of 20 mg prednisolone administered as capsules

intervention.description: oral OD SGRM administered as suspension
oral capsules of 20 mg prednisolone administered OD for two weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Established RA diagnosis according to the 2010 American College of Rheumatology (ACR)/EULAR classification or the 1987 criteria
2. Active RA (DAS28-CRP score ≥ 3.2) with at least 3 swollen joints and 3 tender joints using the DAS28 joint count
3. Patients must have be on stable dosing of conventional and/or s.c./i.v biological DMARDs for the last 8 weeks prior to Visit 1
4. CRP levels >5mg/L at screening if seronegative for Rheumatoid Factor (RF) and Anti-Cyclic Citrullinated Peptide antibody (anti-CCP Ab), or >2mg/L if seropositive for either marker
5. BMI between 18 and 35 (inclusive)
6. Negative pregnancy test (serum) for female subjects of childbearing potential
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History or current inflammatory rheumatic disease other than RA (secondary Sjogren's syndrome excluded)
2. History or current clinically important disease which may either put the subject at risk because of participation in the study, or influence the results or the subject's ability to participate in the study
3. Any clinical contraindications to treatment with steroids
4. Oral or parenteral steroids (beyond study medication) 8 weeks prior to study start and during the study. Stable use and dose of topical and inhaled steroids for longer than 4 w prior to randomization is acceptable
5. Use of any prohibited medication during the study or if the required washout time of such medication was not adhered to
6. History of severe allergy/hypersensitivity or ongoing clinically important allergy/hypersensitivity to drugs with a similar class to study drugs
7. Any concomitant medications that are known to be associated with Torsades de Pointes

clinical_study.keyword: rheumatoid arthritis, swollen joints, tender joints, autoimmunity

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a Phase 2a study conducted in participants with active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in spite of stable treatment with conventional disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs at 5 investigational sites across Sweden and The Netherlands between 18 January 2018 and 12 November 2019.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 21 participants were randomized in a 1:1 ratio to take either AZD9567 or prednisolone in a 2-week double-blind, double-dummy treatment period.

group.title: AZD9567
group.description: Participants received AZD9567 40 milligram (mg) oral suspension and placebo capsules matching with prednisolone, orally once daily, for 2 weeks.

group.title: Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received prednisolone 20 mg oral capsules and placebo oral suspension matching with AZD9567, once daily for 2 weeks.

baseline.population: The Full analysis set (FAS) included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study treatment.

group.title: AZD9567
group.description: Participants received AZD9567 40 mg oral suspension and placebo capsules matching with prednisolone, orally once daily, for 2 weeks.

group.title: Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received prednisolone 20 mg oral capsules and placebo oral suspension matching with AZD9567, once daily for 2 weeks.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Ethnicity (NIH/OMB)
Race (NIH/OMB)

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Least Square (LS) Mean Change From Baseline in 28 Joint Disease Activity Score Using C-Reactive Protein (DAS28-CRP) at Day 15
outcome.description: The DAS28-CRP is a measure of disease activity in RA. The score includes the number of tender and swollen joints (out of 28), CRP level (a measure of inflammation in the blood), and the patient's global assessment (PGA) of health (ranging from very well to very poor). The DAS28-CRP was derived as follows: 0.56 x √[tender joint count 28 (TJC28)] + 0.28 x √[swollen joint count 28 (SJC28)] + 0.014 x global health (GH) + 0.36 x Ln(CRP+1) + 0.96 to produce the overall DAS28-CRP score on a scale ranged from 0-10 with higher score indicating worse RA symptoms. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.
outcome.population: The FAS included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study treatment.

group.title: AZD9567
group.description: Participants received AZD9567 40 mg oral suspension and placebo capsules matching with prednisolone, orally once daily, for 2 weeks.

group.title: Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received prednisolone 20 mg oral capsules and placebo oral suspension matching with AZD9567, once daily for 2 weeks.

measure.title: Least Square (LS) Mean Change From Baseline in 28 Joint Disease Activity Score Using C-Reactive Protein (DAS28-CRP) at Day 15
measure.description: The DAS28-CRP is a measure of disease activity in RA. The score includes the number of tender and swollen joints (out of 28), CRP level (a measure of inflammation in the blood), and the patient's global assessment (PGA) of health (ranging from very well to very poor). The DAS28-CRP was derived as follows: 0.56 x √[tender joint count 28 (TJC28)] + 0.28 x √[swollen joint count 28 (SJC28)] + 0.014 x global health (GH) + 0.36 x Ln(CRP+1) + 0.96 to produce the overall DAS28-CRP score on a scale ranged from 0-10 with higher score indicating worse RA symptoms. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.
measure.population: The FAS included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study treatment.

analysis.p_value_desc: Based on MMRM model with the baseline DAS28-CRP score as a continuous covariate and country, visit and treatment group as categorical fixed effects, as well as visit interaction with treatment group, using unstructured covariance matrix.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20, ACR50 and ACR70 Responses
outcome.description: The ACR20, ACR50 or ACR70 was achieved if there was at least a 20%, 50% or 70% improvement from baseline in swollen joint count 66 (SJC66) and tender joint count 68 (TJC68) and 3 or more of the 5 following assessments: participant's assessment of pain, GH, physician's global assessment of disease activity, participant's assessment of physical function and CRP. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.
outcome.population: The FAS included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Participants with missing ACR assessment at Day 15 were considered as non-responders in the respective analysis.

group.title: AZD9567
group.description: Participants received AZD9567 40 mg oral suspension and placebo capsules matching with prednisolone, orally once daily, for 2 weeks.

group.title: Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received prednisolone 20 mg oral capsules and placebo oral suspension matching with AZD9567, once daily for 2 weeks.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving American College of Rheumatology (ACR) 20, ACR50 and ACR70 Responses
measure.description: The ACR20, ACR50 or ACR70 was achieved if there was at least a 20%, 50% or 70% improvement from baseline in swollen joint count 66 (SJC66) and tender joint count 68 (TJC68) and 3 or more of the 5 following assessments: participant's assessment of pain, GH, physician's global assessment of disease activity, participant's assessment of physical function and CRP. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.
measure.population: The FAS included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Participants with missing ACR assessment at Day 15 were considered as non-responders in the respective analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment comparison ACR20: AZD9567 Vs prednisolone
analysis.p_value_desc: Logistic regression model with the treatment group, country and baseline DAS28-CRP as covariate.

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment comparison ACR50: AZD9567 Vs prednisolone
Treatment comparison ACR70: AZD9567 Vs prednisolone

group.title: Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received prednisolone 20 mg oral capsules and placebo oral suspension matching with AZD9567, once daily for 2 weeks.

measure.title: LS Mean Change From Baseline in Participant's Assessment of Pain Score at Day 15
measure.description: Participant's assessment of pain score was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the ACR. Participant's assessment of pain score was assessed from the amount of pain due to RA on a VAS ranging from 0 (no pain) to 100 (extreme pain). Higher score indicated greater disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.
measure.population: The FAS included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study treatment.

analysis.p_value_desc: The MMRM with the baseline participant's assessment of pain score as a continuous covariate and country, visit and treatment group as categorical fixed effects, as well as visit interaction with treatment group, using unstructured covariance matrix.

outcome.title: LS Mean Change From Baseline in Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity Score at Day 15
outcome.description: Physician's global assessment of disease activity score was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the ACR. The physician's global assessment of disease activity was measured on a VAS ranging from 0 (very well) to 100 (very poor). Higher score indicated greater disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.
outcome.population: The FAS included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study treatment.

group.title: AZD9567
group.description: Participants received AZD9567 40 mg oral suspension and placebo capsules matching with prednisolone, orally once daily, for 2 weeks.

group.title: Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received prednisolone 20 mg oral capsules and placebo oral suspension matching with AZD9567, once daily for 2 weeks.

measure.title: LS Mean Change From Baseline in Physician's Global Assessment of Disease Activity Score at Day 15
measure.description: Physician's global assessment of disease activity score was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the ACR. The physician's global assessment of disease activity was measured on a VAS ranging from 0 (very well) to 100 (very poor). Higher score indicated greater disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.
measure.population: The FAS included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study treatment.

analysis.p_value_desc: The MMRM with the baseline disease activity score as a continuous covariate and country, visit and treatment group as categorical fixed effects, as well as visit interaction with treatment group, using unstructured covariance matrix.

outcome.title: LS Mean Change From Baseline in Participant's Assessment of Physical Function Score at Day 15
outcome.description: Participant's assessment of physical function score was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the ACR. The participant's assessment of physical function across 8 functional areas was measured by health assessment questionnaire. The total score ranging from 0 (no difficulty) to 24 (inability to perform tasks). Higher score indicated greater disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.
outcome.population: The FAS included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study treatment.

group.title: AZD9567
group.description: Participants received AZD9567 40 mg oral suspension and placebo capsules matching with prednisolone, orally once daily, for 2 weeks.

group.title: Prednisolone
group.description: Participants received prednisolone 20 mg oral capsules and placebo oral suspension matching with AZD9567, once daily for 2 weeks.

measure.title: LS Mean Change From Baseline in Participant's Assessment of Physical Function Score at Day 15
measure.description: Participant's assessment of physical function score was evaluated as one of the components that comprised the ACR. The participant's assessment of physical function across 8 functional areas was measured by health assessment questionnaire. The total score ranging from 0 (no difficulty) to 24 (inability to perform tasks). Higher score indicated greater disease severity. Baseline was defined as the last non-missing assessment (scheduled or unscheduled) prior to the first dose of study treatment.
measure.population: The FAS included all participants who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of study treatment.

analysis.p_value_desc: The MMRM with the baseline physical function score as a continuous covariate and country, visit and treatment group as categorical fixed effects, as well as visit interaction with treatment group, using unstructured covariance matrix.

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve Until the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) of AZD9567
outcome.description: The AUClast was determined using non-compartmental method and calculated using the linear trapezoidal rule when concentrations were increased and the logarithmic trapezoidal rule when concentrations were decreased.
outcome.time_frame: Predose and 0.25, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 3, 4 and 6 hour postdose on Day 15.
outcome.population: The Pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis set included all participants with at least 1 quantifiable AZD9567 concentration with a documented related dosing history.

group.title: AZD9567
group.description: Participants received AZD9567 40 mg oral suspension and placebo capsules matching with prednisolone, orally once daily, for 2 weeks.

outcome.title: Last Plasma Concentration Measured Before the Last Dose (Ctrough) of AZD9567
outcome.description: The Ctrough of AZD9567 was determined using non-compartmental method before the last dose on Day 15.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
